member.name: M:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.Create(Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.DatabaseInstance,System.String)
member.summary: Requests that a new DatabaseInstance be created. The state of a successfully created DatabaseInstance is ACTIVE. Only available for projects on the Blaze plan. Projects can be upgraded using the Cloud Billing API https://cloud.google.com/billing/reference/rest/v1/projects/updateBillingInfo. Note that it might take a few minutes for billing enablement state to propagate to Firebase systems.
member.param: The parent project for which to create a database instance, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}`.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.CreateRequest
member.summary: Requests that a new DatabaseInstance be created. The state of a successfully created DatabaseInstance is ACTIVE. Only available for projects on the Blaze plan. Projects can be upgraded using the Cloud Billing API https://cloud.google.com/billing/reference/rest/v1/projects/updateBillingInfo. Note that it might take a few minutes for billing enablement state to propagate to Firebase systems.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.CreateRequest.Parent
member.summary: The parent project for which to create a database instance, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.CreateRequest.DatabaseId
member.summary: The globally unique identifier of the database instance.

member.summary: When set to true, the request will be validated but not submitted.

member.summary: Gets or sets the body of this request.

member.summary: Returns the body of the request.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Marks a DatabaseInstance to be deleted. The DatabaseInstance will be purged within 30 days. The default database cannot be deleted. IDs for deleted database instances may never be recovered or re-used. The Database may only be deleted if it is already in a DISABLED state.
member.param: The fully qualified resource name of the database instance, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}/instances/{database-id}`

member.name: T:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.DeleteRequest
member.summary: Marks a DatabaseInstance to be deleted. The DatabaseInstance will be purged within 30 days. The default database cannot be deleted. IDs for deleted database instances may never be recovered or re-used. The Database may only be deleted if it is already in a DISABLED state.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.DeleteRequest.Name
member.summary: The fully qualified resource name of the database instance, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}/instances/{database-id}`

member.name: M:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.Disable(Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.DisableDatabaseInstanceRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Disables a DatabaseInstance. The database can be re-enabled later using ReenableDatabaseInstance. When a database is disabled, all reads and writes are denied, including view access in the Firebase console.
member.param: The fully qualified resource name of the database instance, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}/instances/{database-id}`

member.name: T:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.DisableRequest
member.summary: Disables a DatabaseInstance. The database can be re-enabled later using ReenableDatabaseInstance. When a database is disabled, all reads and writes are denied, including view access in the Firebase console.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.DisableRequest.Name
member.summary: The fully qualified resource name of the database instance, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}/instances/{database-id}`

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.DisableRequest.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets the body of this request.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.DisableRequest.GetBody
member.summary: Returns the body of the request.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the DatabaseInstance identified by the specified resource name.
member.param: The fully qualified resource name of the database instance, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}/instances/{database-id}`. `database-id` is a globally unique identifier across all parent collections. For convenience, this method allows you to supply `-` as a wildcard character in place of specific collections under `projects` and `locations`. The resulting wildcarding form of the method is: `projects/-/locations/-/instances/{database-id}`.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.GetRequest
member.summary: Gets the DatabaseInstance identified by the specified resource name.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.GetRequest.Name
member.summary: The fully qualified resource name of the database instance, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}/instances/{database-id}`. `database-id` is a globally unique identifier across all parent collections. For convenience, this method allows you to supply `-` as a wildcard character in place of specific collections under `projects` and `locations`. The resulting wildcarding form of the method is: `projects/-/locations/-/instances/{database-id}`.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.List(System.String)
member.summary: Lists each DatabaseInstance associated with the specified parent project. The list items are returned in no particular order, but will be a consistent view of the database instances when additional requests are made with a `pageToken`. The resulting list contains instances in any STATE. The list results may be stale by a few seconds. Use GetDatabaseInstance for consistent reads.
member.param: The parent project for which to list database instances, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}` To list across all locations, use a parent in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/-`

member.name: T:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.ListRequest
member.summary: Lists each DatabaseInstance associated with the specified parent project. The list items are returned in no particular order, but will be a consistent view of the database instances when additional requests are made with a `pageToken`. The resulting list contains instances in any STATE. The list results may be stale by a few seconds. Use GetDatabaseInstance for consistent reads.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.ListRequest.Parent
member.summary: The parent project for which to list database instances, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}` To list across all locations, use a parent in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/-`

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.ListRequest.PageSize
member.summary: The maximum number of database instances to return in the response. The server may return fewer than this at its discretion. If no value is specified (or too large a value is specified), then the server will impose its own limit.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.ListRequest.PageToken
member.summary: Token returned from a previous call to `ListDatabaseInstances` indicating where in the set of database instances to resume listing.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.Reenable(Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.ReenableDatabaseInstanceRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Enables a DatabaseInstance. The database must have been disabled previously using DisableDatabaseInstance. The state of a successfully reenabled DatabaseInstance is ACTIVE.
member.param: The fully qualified resource name of the database instance, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}/instances/{database-id}`

member.name: T:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.ReenableRequest
member.summary: Enables a DatabaseInstance. The database must have been disabled previously using DisableDatabaseInstance. The state of a successfully reenabled DatabaseInstance is ACTIVE.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.ReenableRequest.Name
member.summary: The fully qualified resource name of the database instance, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}/instances/{database-id}`

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.ReenableRequest.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets the body of this request.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.InstancesResource.ReenableRequest.GetBody
member.summary: Returns the body of the request.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.DatabaseInstance
member.summary: Representation of a Realtime Database instance. Details on interacting with contents of a DatabaseInstance can be found at: https://firebase.google.com/docs/database/rest/start.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.DatabaseInstance.DatabaseUrl
member.summary: Immutable. The globally unique hostname of the database.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.DatabaseInstance.Name
member.summary: The fully qualified resource name of the database instance, in the form: `projects/{project-number}/locations/{location-id}/instances/{database-id}`. Currently the only supported location is 'us-central1'.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.DatabaseInstance.Project
member.summary: The resource name of the project this instance belongs to. For example: `projects/{project-number}`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.DatabaseInstance.Type
member.summary: The database instance type. On creation only USER_DATABASE is allowed, which is also the default when omitted.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.DisableDatabaseInstanceRequest
member.summary: The request sent to the DisableDatabaseInstance method.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.ListDatabaseInstancesResponse
member.summary: The response from the ListDatabaseInstances method.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.ListDatabaseInstancesResponse.Instances
member.summary: List of each DatabaseInstance that is in the parent Firebase project.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.ListDatabaseInstancesResponse.NextPageToken
member.summary: If the result list is too large to fit in a single response, then a token is returned. If the string is empty, then this response is the last page of results. This token can be used in a subsequent call to `ListDatabaseInstances` to find the next group of database instances. Page tokens are short-lived and should not be persisted.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.FirebaseRealtimeDatabase.v1beta.Data.ReenableDatabaseInstanceRequest
member.summary: The request sent to the ReenableDatabaseInstance method.
